column1: measure of Fatalities per 1000 recorded crashes is a risk measure of the likelihood of deaths
in 1000 road crashes per police district. The results show that there is significant disparity
between police districts in fatalities per 1000 crashes. The results also show that Police
Districts in urban villages and towns have low rates of fatalities per 1000 crashes though
they have high annual recorded crashes. The results suggests that most of the recorded
crashes in urban villages and towns are not fatal compared to rural areas and crashes along
major highways. The trends indicate that most crashes along major highways are severe
